Sunrise.Fort Lauderdale Executive Airport:
Fort Lauderdale Executive Airport (IATA: FXE, ICAO: KFXE, FAA LID: FXE) is a general aviation airport located within the city limits of Fort Lauderdale, in Broward County, Florida, United States, five miles (8 km) north of downtown Fort Lauderdale. It is a division of the Transportation and Mobility Department of the City of Fort Lauderdale.


== Overview ==
The airport was built in 1941 to train Naval Aviators during World War II, and named West Prospect Satellite Field.
